name: Russelia
description: Russelia is a genus of about 50 species of flowering plants in the family Plantaginaceae, native to Mexico, Cuba and Central America.Most of the species are shrubs, with many small tubular flowers in shades of red, pink and cream. They are great for containers and baskets, while some species are used to hide unattractive walls or fences because of their dense foliage.
meaning: The genus name is given in honor of Scottish naturalist Alexander Russell (1715â€“1768).
color_description: These plants have attractively colored flowers in shades of red, pink and cream.
